remarks: If ` M ` is relatively prime to ` N ` , then the GCD of ` K ` with ` M x. N ` is the product of the GCDs with ` M ` and ` N ` respectively. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jul-2015.)
statement: rpmulgcd2 $p |- ( ( ( K e. ZZ /\ M e. ZZ /\ N e. ZZ ) /\ ( M gcd N ) = 1 ) -> ( K gcd ( M x. N ) ) = ( ( K gcd M ) x. ( K gcd N ) ) ) $.
